Name: Statuette of Osiris-Iah
Description: The statuette represents Osiris as a deity associated with the Moon-god Iah, which engenders a composite iconography. Osiris-Iah is striding, his left foot advanced. He wears a short kilt, a tripartite wig with an uraeus on the forehead crowned with a Moon-disk and a crescent bearing an elaborate atef-crown with horns and extra uraei; his chin is decorated with a pleated artificial beard. In his hands he had originally held some attributes, now missing. There is a tenon below the base of the statuette.
